ingredients: 5.Spices(musturd and cumin seeds,ginger-garlic paste,turmeric,garam masala,chilli powder,chillies,kasuri methi)
steps: 1.Take about 1 cup of soaked dal with 2 and 1/2 cups of water into the pressure cooker.
2.Let it cook for 2 whistles on medium heat and then open the pressure cooker.
3.Heat 1 and 1/2 spoon of ghee in a pan.
4.1/2 teaspoon of cumin seeds and 1 broken dried red chilli.
4.Add 1/8 teespoon of hing and 1 curry leaf.
5.Add finely chopped onionds and 1-2 chopped green chilli.
6.Add ginger garlic paste and 1/2 cup of chopped tomatoes.
7.Saute until the tomatoes turn mushy and soft.
8.Add masalas 1/4 teaspoon turmaric,garam masala and chili powder.
9.Now add the cooked dal into the mixture.
10.Let it cook for 4-5 minutes.
1.You will need ½ cup each of onions and capsicum.cut them into big pieces.
2.You will need 1 tablespoon of crushed ginger-garlic paste.
3.Slice 200 to 250 grams block or paneer into cubes or squares and keep aside.
4.Put 200 grams hung curd in a bowl. With a whisk beat the curd lightly till smoothand add the spices powder.
5.Add ½ tablespoon lemon juice and salt and mustard oil.
6.Mix well then Add the onions, capsicum and paneer to the marinade.
7.Cover and keep the marinated paneer and veggies in the refrigerator for 2 hours or more.
8.Begin to thread the veggies and paneer alternately on bamboo skewers. and grill then at 230 to 240 degrees celsius for 15 to 20 minutes.
9.let them cool and then enjoy.
1.Make the pancake batter by adding the ingredients and mixing them throughly.
2.Pour the batter(1/4 cup) on a medium heated nonstick cooking pan.
3.When the pancake loosens flip the other side to bake.
4.Stack 3-4 such pancakes one upon another and shower some honey(optional) or eat directly.
1.Peel the skin of banana and slice it into very thin slices.
2.place a kadai, pour enough coconut oil on high flame.
3.heat the coconut oil for 5 minutes, take a small piece of banana pour in to the oil.
4.check both the sides are well fried or not else.
5.deep fry and take out the chips.
6.season it with salt and enjoy.
1.Mix green cardamom powder, mace powder, clove powder, cinnamon powder and black cardamom powder.
2.Cut chicken into even size pieces and marinate with garlic paste, ginger paste, salt and some red chilli powder.
3.Finely chop one onion and cut the other into large pieces. Blend tomatoes to make a puree.
4.Heat desi ghee in a pan. Add garlic and ginger paste.
5.When it turns brown, add chopped onions and cook till it turns golden brown. Now add tomato puree and salt.
6.Take some yoghurt in a bowl, add turmeric and red chilli powder and mix it well. Add this mixture to the tomato puree and cook for some time.
7.Add coriander powder, cumin powder, the marinated chicken, the onion cut into large pieces, water and garam masala.
8.season it with salt and enjoy.
1.First rinse 1 cup white chickpeas a couple of times in water. Then soak them in enough water overnight or for 7 to 8 hours.
2.Next day they will double in size.
3.Then drain the water.
4. In a 3 litre pressure cooker add the chickpeas. Also add 3 cups water and ¼ teaspoon salt. I have used a pressure cooker but you can also use a pot or pan.
5.Pressure cook chickpeas for 10 to 12 whistles or for about 15 to 20 minutes or till they are tender and cooked well.
6.Once done then drain all the water and keep the cooked chickpeas aside.
7.chop 1 medium-sized onion, 2 medium-sized tomatoes, 1 green chili, 4 to 5 medium-sized garlic cloves and 1 inch ginger.
8.season it with salt and enjoy.
9.Make a fine paste in a grinder or blender. No need to add water while making the paste as the juice of the tomatoes will help in making the paste. keep the jar aside.
10. Keep stirring often. Sauté for 8 to 10 minutes or more till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste. The paste will also thicken and become glossy.
1. you only need to bring the dough together. If you overwork it, the samosa will be hard.
2.soft dough will not give crispy samosa.
3.always remember to let the dough rest for at least 30 to 40 minutes before you start making the samosa.
4.try to roll the dough thin and evenly. If the dough is rolled thick, it will take a long time for the dough to get cooked. Also we all like thin crispy edges of the samosa, agree?
5. you can apply little oil on your rolling pin.
1.Start by mixing all the ingredients under marinade and adding the chicken to it.
2.Mix well, cover and set aside for 15-30 minutes while you make the gravy.
3.3-4 Once the chicken has been marinating for 15-30 minutes, heat a tablespoon of oil in a cast iron skillet or a non stick pan.
4.  For the gravy, heat 1 tablespoon oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet or pan.
5.Add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, whole red chilies and garlic. Saute for a minute or so till fragrant.
6.Add onions and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes till pink and translucent.
7.8-9 Add tomatoes and cashew nuts. Mix once, reduce the flame to a simmer and cover and cook for 10-15 minutes till the tomatoes start breaking down.
8.season it with salt and enjoy.
9.Make a fine paste in a grinder or blender. No need to add water while making the paste as the juice of the tomatoes will help in making the paste. keep the jar aside.
10. Keep stirring often. Sauté for 8 to 10 minutes or more till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste. The paste will also thicken and become glossy.
1.Start by mixing all the ingredients under marinade and adding the chicken to it.
2.Mix well, cover and set aside for 15-30 minutes while you make the gravy.
3.3-4 Once the chicken has been marinating for 15-30 minutes, heat a tablespoon of oil in a cast iron skillet or a non stick pan.
4.  For the gravy, heat 1 tablespoon oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet or pan.
5.Add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, whole red chilies and garlic. Saute for a minute or so till fragrant.
6.Add onions and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes till pink and translucent.
7.8-9 Add tomatoes and cashew nuts. Mix once, reduce the flame to a simmer and cover and cook for 10-15 minutes till the tomatoes start breaking down.
8.season it with salt and enjoy.
9.Make a fine paste in a grinder or blender. No need to add water while making the paste as the juice of the tomatoes will help in making the paste. keep the jar aside.
1.Start by mixing all the ingredients under marinade and adding the fish to it.
2.And here what you need for the curry sauce in addition to the curry paste.
3. this is to make the spice flavours bloom and cook the onion, garlic and ginger. Also, to cook out the water that we added to help the paste puree.
4. Add coconut milk and remaining sauce ingredient.
5.Add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, whole red chilies and garlic. Saute for a minute or so till fragrant.
6.Add onions and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes till pink and translucent.
7.Simmer for 5 minutes to reduce and bring the flavours together.
8.Add fish in the last few minutes it only takes 3 to 4 minutes to cook.
9.Garnish with fresh coriander and green chillies.
1.Remove the stick from 4-5 chaap and cut them into ½-inch pieces.
2.Add and mix all the pastes and spices to make curry paste.
3. tAdd the soya chaap pieces to the bowl and mix well to coat them with the marinade.
4.Thread the chaap in metal skewers.
5.Cook over direct flame until nicely browned and slightly charred. Keep rotating the skewers at regular intervals so that they brown evenly.
6.Add onions and saute .
7.Cook over direct flame until nicely browned and slightly charred. Keep rotating the skewers at regular intervals so that they brown evenly.
